alert.note: Alert for Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 7:02PM CDT until March 24 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Scott County in central Mississippi... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 702 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Burns, or 11 miles south of Morton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Pulaski around 710 PM CDT. Homewood around 715 PM CDT. Forest around 725 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central and east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
